meanings.sent1: The magician used his cape to englobe the rabbit before making it disappear.
meanings.sent2: She carefully englobed the fragile vase in bubble wrap to protect it during the move.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten tried to englobe itself in a box that was clearly too small.
meanings.sent4: The fog seemed to englobe the entire town, creating an eerie atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The warm embrace of the blanket englobed her in comfort on the cold night.

meanings.definition: To include or contain within a larger whole
meanings.sent1: The recipe book will englobe all your favorite dishes, from appetizers to desserts.
meanings.sent2: The encyclopedia aims to englobe a vast amount of knowledge in its pages.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle pieces seemed to englobe perfectly, forming a complete picture.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to englobe the room, spreading joy to everyone present.
meanings.sent5: The artist's masterpiece managed to englobe the essence of nature in a single painting.
